title: Aurora australis lights up Canberra skies
description: Timelapse footage has captured the moment pink hues shone over Canberra between Wednesday evening and Thursday morning. The Bureau of Meteorology (BOM) issued an alert for a severe geomagnetic storm as southern parts of Australia saw the aurora australis in the sky. #Auroraaustralis #sky #weather #Canberra

title: Bear runs onto airport tarmac in Japan
description: A plucky bear has stalled flights after running onto the tarmac of Japan's Hanamaki Airport, in the country's northeast. #bear #japan #hanamakiairport #airport #plane

title: Gen Alpha expected to ditch computer keyboard in favour of voice notes
description: Gen Alpha is expected to ditch the computer keyboard and use voice notes instead, according to new research from the London School of Economics. #genalpha #keyboard #voicenote #computer #work

title: Teen gets 16 years for grandmother's murder | 7NEWS
description: A 17-year-old boy has been sentenced to 16 years detention for the murder of 70-year-old grandmother Vyleen White, who was stabbed in the heart at a shopping centre car park in Red Bank Plains, Ipswich on February 3, 2024. The Queensland Supreme Court Chief Justice delivered one of the state's harshest juvenile sentences in years, requiring the teenager to serve at least 60 percent of his term. The crime sparked major legal reform across Australia, prompting Queensland's Premier to introduce 'adult time for adult crimes' legislation in December 2023. title: Epstein files reveal Trump emails bombshell | 7NEWS
description: More than 20,000 documents from Jeffrey Epstein's estate have been released following a subpoena by American lawmakers, including cryptic emails mentioning Donald Trump. The emails, exchanged between Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, suggest Trump may have been more aware of trafficking activities than previously admitted, with one email stating 'of course he knew about the girls as he asked Ghislaine to stop.' The White House has labelled the revelations a politically motivated attack, while Trump has denied any wrongdoing and was never charged with crimes related to Epstein. title: Unemployment rate drops to 4.3% in October | 7NEWS
description: Australia's official unemployment rate decreased to 4.3% in October, down from 4.5% in September according to new Bureau of Statistics figures. The slight reduction is not expected to influence the Reserve Bank to consider cutting interest rates at this time. title: Albanese slams Liberal 'clown show' amid Ley leadership crisis | 7NEWS
description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese launches an attack on the Liberal Party, calling them a 'clown show' as they prepare to abandon their net zero emissions by 2050 target while maintaining commitment to the Paris Climate Agreement. Opposition Leader Sussan Ley faces fresh leadership speculation after a show of force by rivals Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie, who walked into the Liberal Party room meeting with more than a dozen conservative colleagues as potential replacements. title: Father killed in Adelaide hit-and-run after machete chase | 7NEWS
description: A 25-year-old father Daniel Harrison was killed in an alleged hit-and-run incident in Hillier, north of Adelaide, after reportedly being hunted by a man with a machete. A 21-year-old Stockport woman has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving and leaving the scene, while a 19-year-old man faces charges related to an earlier altercation and firearm possession. The incident allegedly stemmed from a clash between two groups over a social media post. title: Fortune teller duo charged over $70m fraud | 7NEWS
description: A 53-year-old self-proclaimed fortune teller Anya Phan and her 25-year-old daughter have been charged with defrauding vulnerable Vietnamese community members of over $70 million through fake psychic readings and loan scams. Police arrested the pair at their $13.8 million Dover Heights duplex, seizing evidence including luxury items, a gold bar, casino chips and financial documents. Phan faces 39 charges and was refused bail, with police alleging she pocketed at least $150,000 each time she convinced victims to become financial mules using stolen identities. title: Victoria targets gang leaders recruiting children | 7NEWS
description: Victoria is introducing new laws that could jail gang leaders for life if they recruit children to commit serious crimes like aggravated home invasions or carjackings. Adults who lure children into violent crimes will face increased penalties of up to 15 years imprisonment, up from the current 10 years. Despite 32 recorded incidents of child recruitment over four years, there have been zero convictions to date. title: Police hunt eight protesters after violent Melbourne rally | 7NEWS
description: Police are searching for eight protesters following a violent rally in Melbourne last month where activists threw rocks at officers, injuring two. The incident occurred during opposition to an anti-mass immigration rally before protesters turned on police. The Victorian Government has announced new protest mask laws that the police union has criticised as inadequate. title: AC/DC kicks off Australian Power Up tour | 7NEWS
description: AC/DC has kickstarted the Australian leg of their Power Up tour with 80,000 fans packing into the MCG for a performance of their nostalgic tracks. Before the show, 374 bagpipers gathered in Federation Square to play 'Long Way To The Top', breaking a world record in tribute to the rock legends. title: Young Australians losing hope about financial future | 7NEWS
description: Four out of five young Australians aged 18-24 expect to be worse off financially than their parents according to new Monash University research, with rising costs of living, HECS debt and unaffordable housing creating financial stress. The discussion also covers how working from home and dating apps have impacted workplace romances, and examines a viral TikTok video showing problematic parenting behaviour on a US flight.
